resources.string: \t\tWell here you are in your new environment. Surrounded by unfamiliar faces, doing whatever it is they’re doing, eating God knows what, an alien culture really, and to top it off, you barely understand half of what these weirdos are talking about. Why don’t you try to learn the vernacular and have a better understanding of your new home?
the Administration building where the College of Agriculture and Food Science, and cashier is located.
(pronounced as "an-sai") The Animal Science Complex with an arc that leads to the Vet Med buildings and Animal Science buildings.
short for auditorium or D.L. Umali Hall / Auditorium; the place where most plays, concerts, and symposiums are held.
a student that is unaffiliated with any organization.
(pronounced "bayo-sai") The Institute of Biological Sciences and the Institute of Weed Science, Entomology, and Plant Pathology hold classes here.
your first barkada or group of students having the same degree course.
official answer sheet for quizzes and examinations.
used to call a fraternity member or a male member of an organization.
the tall tower at the lower field of freedom park.
(pronounced "sem") The group of buildings where economics and management classes are held.
refers to the canteen at the back of humanities.
the large gymnasium where most P.E. classes are held. Ride pedicab at AnSci to get there.
short for carabao park. Area between the Admin and kwek-kwek tower. The statue of a man and a carabao can be found here.
short for college scholar. A student that attains a GWA below 1.45 to 1.75.
also known as CEAT (pronounced "se-yat"). Buildings where engineering classes are held.
housing community at the back of the University Library
a huge tree at the lower field where couples go to...be happy.
aka F-Park/Field. The grassy area, where the Carillon tower and the grandstand are located.
considered as the upper campus. It is beyond the University Health Service.
registration form presented to the instructors at the beginning of classes. Serves as the official receipt of enrollment and proof that you are a registered student.
short for grade conscious. A person whose utmost priority is his studies.
found in the lower field of F-Park. The structure with bleachers in it.
the street before the UP Gate.
(pronounced "hyoom") short for Humanities Building. Located behind the Oblation where most general subjects are taken.
short for Honor Roll. A student with a GWA of 1.75 to 2.00.
refers to the University Health Service (UHS). The University\'s hospital.
The annual Freshman 3 on 3 basketball tournament organized by the UP Epsilon Chi Fraternity.
Academic Heritage Tower. The tower with the orange flam located near the DevCom building.
(pronounced as "Meyn-Layb") it is the University\'s library located behind the Pegaraw.
aka Men\'s Dorm. It used to be a men\'s only dorm, then became a co-ed dorm. Now it\'s a women\'s only dorm.
(short for proventriculus) a street food that everyone should try. Try it at Raymundo. Pronounce this as "Proh-ven" not "pru-ven".
can refer to Raymundo Gate or Ruby Street (the street behind Raymundo Gate).
aka Women\'s Dorm. A women\'s only dorm beside Men\'s Dorm.
short for University Scholar. A student with a GWA of 1.00 - 1.45.
the highest possible grade. Aim for this as a freshman.
the grade you\'ll die to get if you stay long enough in the University.
Conditional Pass or Fail. Depends on whether you are an optimist or a pessimist. Talk to your professor if you get this grade.
The bane of UPLB students. Under any circumstance, do not get this grade. EVER!
